Talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>You're the one who saved me from that
nasty bout of food poisoning, aren't you?<sp:5:0:0>
Fancy running into you again.
Our mistake was using monster parts in
cooking. They're supposed to be mixed
with bugs to make elixirs.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>What were we thinking?
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Taking a morning stroll? <sp:5:0:0>It's soothing,
isn't it, the warmth of the morning sun
on your face.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I wonder if <clr:0000>bugs<clr:ffff> can feel the sun on
their faces.
Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Taking a midnight stroll? <sp:5:0:0>I know how
you feel, being drawn out of bed by
the moonlight.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I wonder if <clr:0000>bugs<clr:ffff> look up at the moon.
Talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You've more energy than I, going out on
a midday walk. <sp:5:0:0>The sunlight's already
wearing me down.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I wonder if <clr:0000>bugs<clr:ffff> get tired in the sun.
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, sorry. I've got bugs on the mind. I'm
hoping to catch some and mix them with
<clr:0000>monster parts <clr:ffff>to make a few handy <clr:0000>elixirs<clr:ffff>.
Bugs blend in with nature, so you can't
always see them at first glance.<sp:5:1:0> But
they're all around us.
Crickets are often lurking in patches of
grass, for instance.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>And the bug I'm looking for now, the
rugged rhino beetle, likes to perch on
tree trunks.<sp:0:4:0>If you see one, be sure not to make any
sudden movements. <sp:5:1:0>Bugs scare easily!

Be kind and gentle when you catch the
little guys! Do it lovingly!
Talk_0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I think about bugs so much, I'm starting
to feel a bit like one myself.
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Going on an evening walk? <sp:5:0:0>When the sky
turns deep red like this, I always feel like
doing that too.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I wonder if <clr:0000>bugs<clr:ffff> feel the same way?
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You've got gumption, taking a walk in
the rain. <sp:5:0:0>As for me, I don't like my clothes
getting squidgy.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I wonder if <clr:0000>bugs <clr:ffff>like the rain, or if they
prefer to stay dry like me.
Talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I will say, they're shyer than usual today.<sp:5:0:0>
Maybe because of all the noise above the
treetops? What is that?
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm hoping to catch some bugs and mix
them with <clr:0000>monster parts <clr:ffff>to make <clr:0000>elixirs<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>The bug I'm looking for now, the rugged
rhino beetle, likes to perch on tree trunks.<sp:0:4:0>If you see one, be sure not to make any
sudden movements. <sp:5:1:0>Bugs scare easily!

Be kind and gentle when you catch the
little guys! Do it lovingly!
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Lots of bugs are nocturnal. <sp:5:0:0>And if you
want to catch a nocturnal creature,
you've gotta be one.
That's why I'm going to bed nowâ€”so I can
lay hold of a <clr:0000>rugged rhino beetle <clr:ffff>tonight!
